{{Bluebook}} {{Talk header}} {{ArticleHistory |action1=GAN |action1date=06:09, 3 September 2010 |action1link=Talk:Ex parte Crow Dog/GA1 |action1result=listed |action1oldid=382202802 |action2=PR |action2date=04:34, 6 October 2010 |action2link=Wikipedia:Peer review/Ex parte Crow Dog/archive1 |action2result=reviewed |action2oldid=388001244 |action3=PR |action3date=07:14, 3 August 2012 |action3link=Wikipedia:Peer review/Ex parte Crow Dog/archive2 |action3result=reviewed |action3oldid=505451556 |action4=FAC |action4date=17:19, 11 September 2012 |action4link=Wikipedia:Featured article candidates/Ex parte Crow Dog/archive1 |action4result=promoted |action4oldid=511778031 |dykdate=25 August 2010 |dykentry=... that the [[United States Supreme Court]] ruled that an Indian could not be tried for killing another Indian in '''''[[Ex parte Crow Dog]]''''', resulting in the passage of the [[Major Crimes Act]]? |topic=Law |currentstatus=FA |maindate=October 8, 2013 |four=yes }} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Indigenous peoples of North America|class=FA|importance=mid}} {{WikiProject Law|class=FA|importance=Low}} {{WikiProject South Dakota|class=FA|importance=low}} {{WikiProject U.S. Supreme Court cases|class=FA |importance=low }} }} == Comments == Please let us know how to improve the article. Thanks, [[User:GregJackP|GregJackP]] [[User talk:GregJackP|Boomer!]] 23:32, 25 September 2013 (UTC) == Spelling - and quotes == Hi, GJP. Have been slowly reading article between other tasks. "Accommodationist" is spelled with two m's. Also, I'm not sure I'd put it and "traditionalist" in quotes. I'd just leave the quotes off, or link to Wiktionary. [[User:Lightbreather|Lightbreather]] ([[User talk:Lightbreather|talk]]) 16:21, 27 September 2013 (UTC) :{{Done}} [[User:GregJackP|GregJackP]] [[User talk:GregJackP|Boomer!]] 16:29, 27 September 2013 (UTC) == Ex parte == I didn't know what [[Ex parte]] meant when I saw the article on the main page, it may be helpful to link this somewhere. I see no obvious place though, [[WP:BOLDTITLE]] discourages linking parts of the bolded page title, and "'''Ex parte Crow Dog''' is an [[ex parte]] decision [â€¦]" is pretty much the best I can do myself. :)
[[User talk:Amalthea|Amalthea]] 10:59, 8 October 2013 (UTC) :I came here with the same complaint and idea; I think this would be a valuable explanation for those of us who are unfamiliar with Latin legal terms. I presume the case was ex parte because one of the parties was deceased; if so, maybe it's also worth explaining that as well. [[User:DividedFrame|Brad Baker]] ([[User talk:DividedFrame|talk]]) 20:28, 8 October 2013 (UTC) :Agreed. What does it mean? Even linking to the Wikipedia article does not help much. Is it ex parte because he was dead? Bad omission for a FA! --([[User:AfadsBad|AfadsBad]] ([[User talk:AfadsBad|talk]]) 22:26, 8 October 2013 (UTC)) ::I can add some information to the article, but in the four previous reviews that the article has had, no one picked up on that. It was ''ex parte'' for the reasons stated in the article on ''ex parte'': {{cquote|The phrase has also traditionally been used in the captions of petitions for the [[writ]] of ''[[habeas corpus]]'', which were (and in some jurisdictions, still are) styled as "''Ex parte'' Doe", where [[John Doe|Doe]] was the name of the petitioner who was alleged to be wrongfully held. As the Supreme Court's description of nineteenth century practice in ''[[Ex parte Milligan]]'' shows, however, such proceedings were not ''ex parte'' in any significant sense. The prisoner's ''ex parte'' application sought only an order requiring the person holding the prisoner to appear before the court to justify the prisoner's detention; no order requiring the freeing of a prisoner could be given until after the jailer was given the opportunity to contest the prisoner's claims at a hearing on the merits.}} ::I'll add a footnote. [[User:GregJackP|GregJackP]] [[User talk:GregJackP|Boomer!]] 23:33, 8 October 2013 (UTC) :::Thanks. Even ex parte wasn't linked, though. I also think the term is technical enough that some reviewer should have brought it up. This is a general encyclopedia, not a law site. --([[User:AfadsBad|AfadsBad]] ([[User talk:AfadsBad|talk]]) 23:48, 8 October 2013 (UTC)) == Chart == The chart under "tribal sovereignty" should be checked by someone who knows what's accurate or not. A row was deleted and one of the remaining columns was changed by [[User:Y]] around noon on Oct. 8. [[User:Woodshed|Woodshed]] ([[User talk:Woodshed|talk]]) 01:56, 9 October 2013 (UTC) :Thanks, I checked and it is accurate. [[User:GregJackP|GregJackP]] [[User talk:GregJackP|Boomer!]] 03:29, 9 October 2013 (UTC)
